channel.title: No one can connect
channel.description:
my source is online (ports-no-ip) but when i try yo login with the client it just give me . :error connecting to server , or , Word is full try another or something like that. i got the the newest java.
server: InsidiaX
Where is the problem :S

item.title: No one can connect
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

easy fix, you have to use 127.0.0.1 to login otherwise it will say error connecting to server, no-ip was made for other people to connect on the server, if they can’t connect you have not properly portforwarded right on your router or changed the server ip to your no-ip and then released it to them! and if your brother can’t connect using the no-ip its the same problem with portforward or the source only allows 1 ip per login to stop syipkpker bots and stuff you would have to make it allow more.

[size=8pt]What has moparscape forums become now days… trashing talking site?
I thought everyone was equal[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: No one can connect
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Okay here is your problem…the error isn’t very specific about what the issue is…

Below is a list of possible reasons. You should try to research to see which it is…

-your not ported correctly. ( refer to porforwarding tutorials on google and in the server section. )
-for YOUR internet, anybody on your router so your brother etc must use 127.0.0.1. Everyone else must use the no-ip
-your firewall is blocking your connection
-is udp etc opened? ( there are a couple of tools out there to check)

Read full topic

item.title: No one can connect
item.dc:creator: @Gypsy Gypsy
item.description:
@Gypsy wrote:

You are facing a port forwarding error. If properly port forwarded, you are able to connect to your no-ip address even if on a local connection.

Read full topic

You can only connect with localhost (127.0.0.1) the no-ip port is for your players.
